isis.stitle: Side Mount Cooling Package - RE Bus - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - Radiator Fan

svcprocinfo.para: The radiator fan can be removed and installed without removing the cooling package.

step1.para: Unlatch and open the rear compartment service doors, left-side door, and rear door.
Place a suitable container under the lower hydraulic hose to catch the hydraulic oil from the system.
Remove P-clips and wire ties as needed from the lower hydraulic hose ( Figure 8, Item 2).
Disconnect the lower hydraulic hose from the hydraulic pump and position lower hydraulic hose into the container for draining ( Figure 8).

item.para: Tag and mark hoses before removal to ensure proper installation.
Cap and plug all hoses upon removal to stop leakage and prevent contamination.

step1.para: Disconnect two power steering hoses from the hydraulic reservoir ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 4).
Disconnect two hydraulic hoses from the hydraulic reservoir ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 2).
Disconnect the hydraulic pilot hose from the hydraulic reservoir ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 3).
Remove four bolts, washers, and nuts from the hydraulic reservoir and mount bracket ( Figure 9).
Remove the hydraulic reservoir from the mount bracket ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 5).
Remove six bolts and washers from the radiator fan and hydraulic fan drive motor hub. Position the radiator fan in the radiator shroud and against the radiator ( Figure 15).
Remove 12 nuts from the spider cage and radiator frame.

caution.para: When repositioning the spider cage, exercise caution. The hydraulic hoses are still connected to the hydraulic fan drive motor. Failure to comply could result in damage to components.

step1.para: Position and secure the spider cage as far away from the fan shroud as possible.
Carefully lift the radiator fan out of the fan shroud. The radiator fan can be worked around the spider cage by turning the radiator fan clockwise around the right upright of the spider cage.

Carefully lower the radiator fan down into the fan shroud. The radiator fan can be worked around the spider cage by turning the radiator fan counterclockwise around the right upright of the spider cage ( Figure 22).
Position the spider cage onto the radiator frame ( Figure 21, Items 2 and 4).
Install 12 nuts on the spider cage and radiator frame ( Figure 21, Items 1, 2, and 4). Torque nuts to 41 to 50 lbf-ft (56 to 68 N•m).
Install the radiator fan on the hydraulic fan drive motor hub and secure with six bolts and washers ( Figure 15). Torque bolts to 30 to 38 lbf-ft (41 to 52 N•m).
Install the hydraulic reservoir on the mount bracket and secure with four nuts, washers, and bolts ( Figure 9). Torque bolts to 100 to 120 lbf-ft (136 to 163 N•m).

caution.para: Some hydraulic hoses and fittings in the hydraulic system are equipped with O-rings to seal the hydraulic hoses. Inspect all O-rings prior to installation and replace as needed.

step1.para: Connect the hydraulic pilot hose to the hydraulic reservoir ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 3).
Connect two hydraulic hoses to the hydraulic reservoir ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 2).
Connect two power steering hoses to the hydraulic reservoir ( Figure 9, Items 1 and 4).
Connect the lower hydraulic hose on the hydraulic pump ( Figure 8).
Install P-clips and wire ties on the lower hydraulic hose as needed ( Figure 8, Item 2).
Fill the hydraulic system.
Close and latch the rear compartment service door.
